title: THG Sports
text:
THG Sports (The Hospitality Group) was a provider of sports ticketing services and <a href="corporate">corporate</a> <a href="hospitality">hospitality</a> programmes at <a href="sporting%20events">sporting events</a> around the world It has 69 offices globally and has around 3,000 employees who provide access to over 350 major events each year. It focuses primarily on: <a href="soccer">soccer</a>, <a href="rugby%20football">rugby</a>, <a href="American%20football">American football</a>, <a href="sport%20of%20athletics">athletics</a>, <a href="horse%20racing">horse racing</a>, <a href="Formula%20One">Formula One</a> motor racing, and <a href="tennis">tennis</a>.
The company was owned by the <a href="Marcus%20Evans">Marcus Evans</a> group whose other sporting interests include ownership of <a href="Ipswich%20Town%20Football%20Club">Ipswich Town Football Club</a>, English League champions in 1962.
History.
THG (The Hospitality group) was founded in 1983 as the division of the <a href="Marcus%20Evans%20Group">Marcus Evans Group</a> whose goal it was to combine corporate hospitality with premier international sporting events. It has organised hospitality functions at distinguished events like the <a href="US%20Grand%20Prix">US Grand Prix</a>, <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup">World Cup Soccer</a>, <a href="Masters%20Tournament">Masters</a>, <a href="US%20Open%20%28tennis%29">US Open</a> and the <a href="Final%20Four">Final Four</a>.
The company has steadily expanded; its core business diversifying into the provision of business intelligence through business conferences, summits, business training and the publication of comprehensive reports on strategic industry issues. In October 2000, the new corporate identity and image was announced as <a href="Marcus%20Evans">Marcus Evans</a>.
Offices.
THG’s European headquarters are in <a href="London">London</a>. Its North American headquarters are in <a href="Chicago">Chicago</a>, with offices in <a href="San%20Diego">San Diego</a> and <a href="Montreal">Montreal</a>.
London Olympics 2012 and Olympic tickets.
In 2010, The <a href="Olympic%20Council%20of%20Ireland">Olympic Council of Ireland</a> (OCI) appointed THG as its official ticketing agent for the 2012 <a href="2012%20Summer%20Olympics">London Olympics</a> and the <a href="2014%20Winter%20Olympics">2014 Winter Olympics</a> in <a href="Sochi">Sochi</a>.
In early 2011 following the announcement from the <a href="LOCOG">London Organising Committee of the Olympic and Paralympics Games (LOCOG)</a>, a division of THG – THG Sports Tours - was confirmed as Authorised Ticket Reseller (ATR) for three European Olympic Councils (<a href="Ireland">Ireland</a>, <a href="Greece">Greece</a> and Malta) ahead of the London 2012 Olympic Games, taking place from 27 July to 12 August 2012 The company is one of several overseas official ticketing agencies which are currently in the spotlight due to a series of unfortunate incidents of fraudulent ticket touting on unauthorised websites. 
Popular consumer <a href="Consumer%20organization">watchdogs</a> like the <a href="BBC">BBC</a>’s <a href="Moneybox">Moneybox</a> programme have been strongly advising people to only deal with official ticket agencies as listed on the main London Olympics 2012 website.
Football Association of Ireland (FAI).
Dublin’s Aviva Stadium on the site of the old Landsdowne Road Stadium was officially opened in May 2010 and is the venue for home matches for its main tenants, the Irish Rugby Union team and the <a href="Football%20Association%20of%20Ireland">Football Association of Ireland</a> (FAI) team. THG is the sole hospitality provider for FAI games at the stadium.
Super Bowl.
In 2011, THG celebrated its 20-year association with Super Bowl hospitality in Dallas, Texas.
